text: I've gotten a lot of comments asking me
about the music that I've used in my
videos and where I get it from so I
thought I'd make a quick video talking
about some of the resources that I've
used in the past as well as what I'm
currently using to find music and sound
effects if you like these kinds of
videos please give it a thumbs up don't
forget to subscribe to my youtube
channel and click on notifications so
you don't miss out on my next video
first I'll start off with some free
options that I used to use if you've
already made some YouTube videos then
you probably already know about the
YouTube audio library this is a
collection of songs and sound effects
that can be used absolutely free of
charge on YouTube this is a great easy
place to start out the downside to this
is that the selection is limited and the
songs have been used so many times in so
many other videos and it's not likely
that your music choice is going to stand
out or be particularly special another
free option is in ComTech I used to use
this website quite a bit to get music
for some of my older videos all you have
to do is give credit in the description
of your videos and proper crediting
procedures can be found on the FAQ
section of their website SoundCloud is
another option for finding free music
once you find a track you like you
basically contact the artist and ask for
their permission to use their song they
might say no or they might not even
reply so this can be a very tedious
process to go through one issue that
I've run into is that an artist might
change record companies and with their
new contract you might lose the rights
to use the music that you've already use
this can lead to issues of demonisation
or videos being taken down a few of my
videos were actually demonetized for
this exact reason so just be aware of
this as for paid options you can opt to
purchase single songs or pay a monthly
subscription to get access to an entire
library of songs I've purchased single
songs from audio jungle an audio micro
in the past both have pretty good
selections and their prices are more or
less comparable this option can get very
expensive though if you don't like
reusing the same songs over again and if
you are constantly purchasing new ones
and as last and in my opinion the best
option is a subscription-based service
this is where you pay a
we fee and you get access to an
unlimited amount of songs to download
and use I've been using epidemic music
for over two years now and it's been by
far my favorite source of music and
sound effects now you do have to be
careful with some other
subscription-based music sites
cancelling your subscription with other
websites can cause you to lose your
rights to use the music that you've
already downloaded and used in your
videos
this means that videos that you've
already uploaded could become
demonetised
or taken down with epidemic you maintain
rights to use the songs that you've
already downloaded even if you cancel
your subscription they have tens of
thousands of tracks to choose from and
there is no limit to how many songs you
can download pretty much all the music
that I've used the last two years have
come from epidemic and there is no
reason why I will be switching services
anytime soon no this wasn't a sponsored
video or anything I've just gotten so
many questions about the music in my
videos and if you are interested in
trying out epidemic for yourself please
do click on the link in the description
and you can get a 30-day trial if you do
end up subscribing I will get a small
compensation for providing the link but
this comes at no extra cost to you and
it does help me out a little bit and
allow me to keep making videos so if you
like this video please give it a thumbs
up and let me know down below in the
comments if there are any other music
services that you use thanks again for
watching and I'll see you guys again in
a few days time with another video bye
